sources.title: Move On (1917) Directed By Gilbert Pratt, Billy Gilbert
sources.description: Move On Directed by Billy Gilbert Gilbert Pratt Written by H. M. Walker Produced by Hal Roach Starring Harold Lloyd Cinematography Walter Lundin Release date December 9, 1917 Country United States Languages Silent English intertitles Move On is a 1917 American short comedy film featuring Harold Lloyd . A print survives in the Museum of Modern Art film archive. [ 1 ] Plot Harold plays a policeman who gets into a series of misadventures while patrolling a park. He runs afoul of his superior while attempting to woo the man's nanny while on duty. Cast Harold Lloyd as Chester Fields [ 2 ] Snub Pollard Bebe Daniels W.L. Adams William Blaisdell Sammy Brooks Marie Gilbert William Gillespie Max Hamburger Bud Jamison Oscar Larson Maynard Laswell (as M.A. Laswell) Gus Leonard Chris Lynton M.J. McCarthy Susan Miller Belle Mitchell Fred C. Newmeyer Charles Stevenson References 1 "Progressive Silent Film List: Move On" . Silent Era . Retrieved April 22, 2009 . 2 Move On (1917) directed by Gilbert Pratt, Billy Gilbert • Reviews, film + cast • Letterboxd , retrieved April 21, 2022 From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

metadata.Plot: Our hero is a police officer who gets involved in a crap game, flirting with a nurse and other amusements.
